Hanya Satu Populasi Badak Jawa, KLHK Belum Ubah Status Konservasi
04 Nov 2019, 21:41 by Denisa Tristianty


Hanya Satu Populasi Badak Jawa, KLHK Belum Ubah Status Konservasi

Jakarta, KBRN : Kementerian Lingkungan Hidup dan Kehutanan (KLHK) menyatakan belum terdapat perubahan status konservasi Indonesia tahun 2019. Bahkan, kelangkaan badak Jawa di Indonesia masih belum juga mengalami perubahan status dengan satu populasi berjumlah di bawah seratus ekor.
“Jadi, sampai sekarang juga masih critically in danger. Jadi, tidak punah,” kata Direktur Konservasi Keanekaragaman Hayati KLHK, Indra Exploitasia di Jakarta, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Senin (4/11/2019).
Indra mengklaim, saat ini status konservasi satwa di Indonesia masih stabil. Malahan dia memastikan terjadi peningkatan secara umum.
Sedangkan, menurut data Yayasan Badak Indonesia (YBI) berdasarkan rilis Balai Taman Nasional Ujung Kulon (TNUK) tahun 2016, jumlah badak Jawa hanya 67 ekor. YBI juga mencatat, polpulasi badak Jawa saat ini hanya terdapat di Ujung Kulon.
Badak Jawa sudah dinyatakan punah di Vietnam, tahun 2010 silam, masih dari catatan YBI.
“(KLHK) belum mengetahui secara persis jumlah kemungkinan satwa terancam punah di Indonesia,” kata Indra.
Ternyata, KLHK masih menunggu data terbaru International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) atau Uni Internasional untuk Konservasi Alam. Sebab, kata dia, KLHK menggunakan semua kategori yang ditetapkan IUCN sebagai dasar menetapkan status konservasi di Indonesia.
Di sisi lain, Indra juga menyatakan KLHK masih melakukan penelitian dan kajian.
“IUCN menetapkan status konservasi satwa di seluruh dunia dari (kategori) vulnerable atau rentan, critaclly in danger atau dalam bahaya, dan sampai dengan status kepunahan,”katanya.
Terkait jumlah badak Jawa yang terdata KLHK saat ini, Indra menyebutkan peningkatan  satu angka bila dibandingkan dari data Balai TNUK tahun 2016.
“Populasi badak Jawa meningkat, dari 62 menjadi 68 (ekor). Paling tidak, kami sudah bisa melihat bahwa terjadi peningkatan dalam satu kondisi habitat tertentu, badak Jawa meningkat,” ucap dia. (ANTARA FOTO/Moch Asim/kye/15)

Only One Javan Rhino Population, KLHK Has Not Changed Conservation Status
Nov 04 2019, 21:41 by Denisa Tristianty


Only One Javan Rhino Population, KLHK Has Not Changed Conservation Status

Jakarta, KBRN: The Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK) states that there has been no change in Indonesia's conservation status in 2019. In fact, the rarity of Javan rhinos in Indonesia has still not changed status with a population of less than one hundred.
"So, until now it is still critically in danger. So, it is not extinct, "said Director of Biodiversity Conservation of KLHK, Indra Exploitasia in Jakarta, as reported by Antara News Agency on Monday (11/04/2019).
Indra claimed, the current status of animal conservation in Indonesia is still stable. Instead he made sure there was a general improvement.
Meanwhile, according to data from the Indonesian Rhinoceros Foundation (YBI) based on the 2016 release of the Ujung Kulon National Park (TNUK), the number of Javan rhinos is only 67. YBI also noted that the Javan rhino polls are currently only in Ujung Kulon.
The Javan rhino was declared extinct in Vietnam, back in 2010, still from YBI records.
"(KLHK) does not yet know the exact number of possible endangered animals in Indonesia," Indra said.
As it turns out, KLHK is still waiting for the latest data from the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Because, he said, KLHK uses all categories determined by IUCN as the basis for establishing conservation status in Indonesia.
On the other hand, Indra also said KLHK was still conducting research and studies.
"IUCN establishes the status of animal conservation throughout the world from (category) vulnerable or vulnerable, critically dangerous or in danger, and to the status of extinction," he said.
Regarding the current number of Javan rhinos recorded by KLHK, Indra mentioned an increase of one point when compared to the 2016 TNUK Balai data.
"The population of Javan rhinos has increased, from 62 to 68 (tail). At least, we can see that there has been an increase in one particular habitat condition, Javan rhino has increased, "he said. (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Moch Asim / kye / 15)
